summary: Vyasa, also known as Krishna Dvaipayana, is a famous Hindu sage. He is considered the author of many important Hindu texts, including the *Mahābhārata*, one of the longest epic poems in the world. Vyasa is seen as an incarnation of the god Vishnu by many Hindus. He is credited with organizing the Vedas, a collection of ancient sacred texts, into four parts. People believe he is still alive, even during the current age, Kali Yuga.
title: Vyasa
